activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin R Johnson

records.addlTxt:
1:18 p.m. Defendant Justin R Johnson in court.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Justin R Johnson. Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Wavier of Preliminary Hearing.  Court questions Defendant.  The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and binds over for trial.  Arraignment set.  Address and phone number confirmed.  Bond continues.
Arraignment scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:18 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin R Johnson in court.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Justin R Johnson.  Reading waived, preliminary examination requested, time limits waived. Preliminary hearing set for 9/6/2022 at 1:00 pm.  Parties may appear by Zoom. Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Atty Nicholas Davis appears on behalf of Defendant

Adjustment Number: 22A 051549,
Payable Number: 127663,
Receipt Number: 22RP001859,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian Wright in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin R Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Justin R Johnson for today.
Defendant needs to contact Public Defender's office. If he does not qualify, he may apply for court appointed counsel or hire his own lawyer.  Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
